title: Textile, 1000–1400
medium:
Medium: cotton, wool
Technique: (2 sides) A: warp stripe, warp -faced plain weave; B: complementary warps; sides intact; ends with warp selvage
creditline: Gift of the Museum of the Cranbrook Academy of Art
description: Rectangular piece made up of central section with border sewn on either side. Fringe on three sides. In the borders, warps form stripes in one part and bird designs in another. In the central section, warps form stripes in one part and design of interlocking birds' heads in another. Colors are brown, tan, and shades of red and yellow.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, 1000–1400.
1000–1400. Medium: cotton, wool
Technique: (2 sides) A: warp stripe, warp -faced plain weave; B: complementary warps; sides intact; ends with warp selvage. Gift of the Museum of the Cranbrook Academy of Art. 1947-49-2.
